intro: Alsine bosniaca, commonly known as Bosnian sandwort, is a low-growing annual herb native to the Balkan region. It typically reaches a height of 10–30 cm and features a prostrate or ascending stem covered with fine, hairy hairs. The plant produces small, white to pink flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are linear to lanceolate, often with a waxy coating, and are arranged alternately along the stem. Alsine bosniaca thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
